New Records: Turkey booked their spot in the last 16 for the first time since 2008
Key Match Events: Czech Republic had Antonin Barak sent off in the first half
Tomas Soucek scored a goal for Czech Republic after Turkey goalkeeper Mert Gunok fumbled the ball
Cenk Tosun scored a last-gasp winner for Turkey
Tomas Chory was sent off after the final whistle was blown
Pre-Game Insights: Turkey only had to avoid defeat to progress to the latter stages
The Czechs were already without their record scorer at the Euros in the form of the injured Patrik Schick
Post-Match Reflections: Turkey finish second in Group F with seeing them progress as one of the best third-placed teams
The Czechs, who reached the last eight in the previous Euros, end up rock bottom and head home early
Turkey will now meet Austria in the last 16 next Tuesday
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw a total of 16 yellow and two red cards, making it the most ill-disciplined match in European Championship history
Hakan Ã‡alhanoglu was awarded the player of the match for his fine individual display
